inclusion.criterion: immediately refer to WAI evaluation without previously providing information about the purpose of the study
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: if for work reasons or force majeure the worker cannot immediately go to the place where the WAI evaluator is, an appointment will be made for another day according to the worker's availability
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: informed consent process: informed consent will be asked by the same evaluator in a room designated by the ACHS protecting the privacy of the participant
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: evaluators: external personnel to the ACHS (evaluators) will be contracted and supervised by Medwave Estudios Limitada, and trained by the ACHS
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: application of the instrument: the WAI will be applied in the office designated by the ACHS with approximately 30-45 minutes for this interview
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: equipment and materials: the room where the WAI is applied must be provided with a table and at least one chair with enough comfort for the patient to be seated during the duration of the interview
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: measurements: general background of the worker and his place of work will be evaluated, as well as the worker's sociodemographic characteristics
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: WAI interpretation: once the WAI evaluation is obtained, it should be sent in the pre-established digital format to the ACHS office where it will be reviewed by a professional evaluator from the ACHS staff
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: final professional evaluator (ACHS) must issue an opinion with three possibilities: 1) possible occupational origin, 2) discarded occupational origin and 3) doubtful
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: the final result of the WAI must be available not later than 15 business days, always before the result
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: patient is a 60-year-old Spanish man presenting with shortness of breath about a day before
inclusion.label: unknown

inclusion.criterion: symptoms began acutely and progressively worsened
inclusion.label: unknown

inclusion.criterion: known case of COPD since 2 years ago
inclusion.label: unknown

exclusion.criterion: not consulting within the study recruitment timetable for a consecutive sample
exclusion.label: does_not_trigger

exclusion.criterion: patients with physical limitations that preclude administering the instrument
exclusion.label: unknown

exclusion.criterion: patients with prior diagnosis of the included disorder (see above)
exclusion.label: triggers

notes: The patient is a 60-year-old Spanish man presenting with shortness of breath about a day before. He has a known case of COPD since 2 years ago.
